metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9910 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low.
metadata.Description:
The serializer in html5lib before 0.99999999 might allow remote attackers to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks by leveraging mishandling of special characters in attribute values, a different vulnerability than CVE-2016-9909.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9910` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python3-html5lib - 0.999999999-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> same commit as CVE-2016-9909 fix changes externally visible api from True|False boolean to a ternary value, which will break users.

criterions.comment: html5lib package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.999999999-1').
